newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish shares rally, advances seen continuing.
newsitem.headline: Danish shares rally, advances seen continuing.

text.p: Danish share prices closed higher on Wednesday, regaining much of Tuesday's losses in a correction expected to continue on Thursday.
"We shall most probably hold this level, with the possibility of a quarter percent rise depending on this evening's development in the United States," a dealer said.
The KFX top-20 index gained 0.65 point to 128.64 in overall bourse turnover of 914 million crowns.
It closed at 128.77 Monday but fell to 128.40 on Tuesday. The KFX December future rose 0.45 point to 128.15 with 380 contracts each worth 100,000 crowns traded.
Sophus Berendsen, which suffered a 51-crown fall to 675 crowns after making a profits warning on Monday, rose 10 crowns to 704 on Wednesday, having clawed back 19 crowns on Tuesday.

SAS was heavily traded, with 433,000 shares changing hands, but the price stayed unchanged at 71.50. The airline, which announced a sharp drop in profits on Tuesday, is likely to be the centre of attention again on Thursday.
"There was analysts' meeting (with SAS) in Oslo today, so that is likely to sharpen interest," a dealer said. --Uffe Hansen, Copenhagen newsroom +45 33 969658
